page.title: 08SOCIAL SURVEY
page.content: THERE WAS ALMOST{100%}AGREEMENT THAT THE{MOST SIGNIFICANT DEVELOPMENT}NOTED IN THE IMMEDIATE PAST IS THE NUMBER OF NEW HOUSES THAT HAVE BEEN BUILT IN THE AREA.IN{DOWNGATE}THERE NOW HAS TO BE VERY{STRICT CONTROL OVER NEW HOUSING. {THE DEVELOPMENT AT KYL COBER PARC}IN STOKE CLIMSLAND, A MIXTURE OF PRIVATE AND COUNCIL HOUSING ON LAND SOLD TO NORTH CORNWALL DISTRICT COUNCIL BY THE THE DUCHY OF{CORNWALL,}WITH PROPOSALS FOR A SMALL NUMBER OF LIGHT INDUSTRIAL UNITS, MAY WELL BE THE{BEGINNING OF A {GREATER EXPANSION OF HOUSING}IN THE SURVEY AREA. GREAT CONCERN WAS VOICE BY A LARGE NUMBER OF PEOPLE THAT THE INFLUX OF NON CORNISH PEOPLE HAD SO INFLATED HOUSING PRICES THAT YOUNG LOCAL PEOPLE WERE HAVING TO MOVE TO NEARBY TOWNS TO SET UP HOMES. IT WAS FELT THAT THE 'CORNISHNESS' OF THE AREA WAS DIMINISHING ALL TOO RAPIDLY.
